verses.verse: Then Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"How <S%H575><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will you speak <S%H4448><s%> these things? <S%H561><s%> Shall the words of your mouth <S%H6310><s%> be a mighty <S%H3524><s%> wind? <S%H7307><s%>
Does God <S%H410><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> justice? <S%H4941><s%> Or does the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> righteousness? <S%H6664><s%>
If your children <S%H1121><s%> have sinned <S%H2398><s%> against him, <S%H7971><s%> He has delivered them into the hand of <S%H3027><s%> their disobedience. <S%H6588><s%>
If you want to seek <S%H7836><s%> God <S%H410><s%> diligently, <S%H7836><s%> make your supplication <S%H2603><s%> to the Almighty. <S%H7706><s%>

If you were pure <S%H2134><s%> and upright, <S%H3477><s%> surely now he would awaken <S%H5782><s%> for you, <S%H5116><s%> and make the habitation of your righteousness <S%H6664><s%> prosperous. <S%H7999><s%>
Though your beginning <S%H7225><s%> was small, <S%H4705><s%> yet your latter end <S%H319><s%> would greatly <S%H3966><s%> increase. <S%H7685><s%>
"Please inquire <S%H7592><s%> of past <S%H7223><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%> Find <S%H3559><s%> out about the learning <S%H2714><s%> of their fathers. <S%H1><s%>
(For we are but of yesterday, <S%H8543><s%> and know <S%H3045><s%> nothing, <S%H3117><s%> because our days on earth <S%H776><s%> are a shadow. <S%H6738><s%>)
Shall they not teach <S%H3384><s%> you, <S%H559><s%> tell you, <S%H3318><s%> and utter words <S%H4405><s%> out of their heart? <S%H3820><s%>
"Can the papyrus <S%H1573><s%> grow up <S%H1342><s%> without mire? <S%H1207><s%> Can <S%H7685><s%> the rushes <S%H260><s%> grow <S%H7685><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> water? <S%H4325><s%>
While it is yet in its greenness, <S%H3><s%> not cut down, <S%H6998><s%> it withers <S%H3001><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> any other reed. <S%H2682><s%>
So are the paths <S%H734><s%> of all who forget <S%H7911><s%> God. <S%H410><s%> The hope <S%H8615><s%> of the godless <S%H2611><s%> man shall perish, <S%H6><s%>
Whose confidence <S%H3689><s%> shall break apart, <S%H6990><s%> Whose trust <S%H4009><s%> is a spider <S%H5908><s%>'s web. <S%H1004><s%>
He shall lean <S%H8172><s%> on his house, <S%H1004><s%> but it shall not stand. <S%H5975><s%> He shall cling <S%H2388><s%> to it, <S%H6965><s%> but it shall not endure.
He is green <S%H7373><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%> His shoots <S%H3127><s%> go forth <S%H3318><s%> over his garden. <S%H1593><s%>
His roots <S%H8328><s%> are wrapped around <S%H5440><s%> the rock pile. <S%H1530><s%> He sees <S%H2372><s%> the place <S%H1004><s%> of stones. <S%H68><s%>
If he is destroyed <S%H1104><s%> from his place, <S%H4725><s%> then it shall deny <S%H3584><s%> him, <S%H7200><s%> saying, 'I have not seen you.'
Behold, <S%H4885><s%> this is the joy of his way: <S%H1870><s%> out of the earth, <S%H6083><s%> others <S%H312><s%> shall spring. <S%H6779><s%>
"Behold, <S%H410><s%> God will not cast away <S%H3988><s%> a blameless <S%H8535><s%> man, <S%H2388><s%> neither will he uphold the evildoers. <S%H7489><s%>
He will still fill <S%H4390><s%> your mouth <S%H6310><s%> with laughter, <S%H7814><s%> your lips <S%H8193><s%> with shouting. <S%H8643><s%>
Those who hate <S%H8130><s%> you shall be clothed <S%H3847><s%> with shame. <S%H1322><s%> The tent <S%H168><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall be no more. <S%H369><s%>"
